entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS FROM WARM TEMPERATURES... Previous record heat has produced significant snowmelt in higher terrain. This has caused high water levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. This includes the Chilkat, the Klehini, and Taiya Rivers. No flooding is expected, with levels slowly dropping through Friday from cooler
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
